intro: Xanthophyllum molle, commonly known as the yellow-flowered wood sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is native to parts of North America, particularly in the eastern United States. It thrives in moist, woodland environments and is often found in shaded areas with rich, organic soil. Xanthophyllum molle is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense ground cover in its natural habitat.
